column2: MASSACHUSETTS DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column8: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 2. This sign indicates:
3. This sign means drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
column8: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.
column10: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.

column2: 4. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column6: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.

column2: 5. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: remove the sign and move forward.
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.
column8: look for a detour or another route.

column2: 6. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column6: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 7. This sign means:
8. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column6: slow down and keep well to the right.
column10: slow down and keep well to the left.

column2: 9. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column8: Drivers should walk more and drive less.
column10: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.

column2: 10. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: only if you have an emergency.
column6: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column8: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column10: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.

column2: 11. When driving in fog, drivers should:
column8: use low beam headlights to better illuminate the road ahead.

column2: 12. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column8: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 13. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
14. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
15. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: try pumping it to increase pressure.
column6: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column8: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.

column2: 16. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
17. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
18. The picture shows:
19. This road sign means:
20. The sign in the picture:
column4: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column6: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column10: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.

column2: 21. When driving on major highways you should:
column8: be ready to react to road hazards.

column2: 22. Your BAC depends on:
column8: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 23. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column6: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.

column2: 24. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column6: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 25. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column6: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column8: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column10: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
